headline: WABE's Week In Review: Trump's lack of influence on Georgia's GOP primary moves incumbents to November
sentences:
Our story for @NPR https://t.co/f9rqZmiXBZ
 Sam Gringlas (@gringsam) May 25, 2022
Get more on the results of Tuesdays primaries and what to expect next in our podcasts Georgia Votes 2022 and Political Breakfast.

Ill still teach the same way
Its now illegal in Georgia to teach certain divisive concepts in K-12 public schools, including that U.S. is systemically racist or individuals are inherently racist.
Georgia's Republican Governor Brian Kemp has fended off a Trump-backed primary challenger who premised his campaign on the false claim that the 2020 election was stolen.
Those were two offices Trump blamed for him losing the 2020 election based on unfounded allegations of voter fraud.
Critics say the law is an attempt to stop teachers from mentioning race at all in the classroom.
The highest-profile races included ones for governor and secretary of state.
But that isnt stopping some teachers from talking about race.
We hear from one of them.
